author: 侯瑞宁
title: 身穿ZOOMLION商标工装男子别停摩托车，中联重科深夜回应|摩托车_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
近日， 一身穿 中联重科 工装的男子驾车连续变道 、 逼停摩托车 并大骂 摩托车 司机的视频，在网上引发关注。中联重科紧急作出回应。
中联重科在7月16日深夜发布声明回应称， 我司关注到网上流传“一身着中联重科工装 ( 带有ZOOMLION商标LOGO字样 ) 的男子别停摩托车”的视频。我司对此高度重视，立即展开全面核查。经调查确认，该男子并非我司员工，与我司无劳动关系，其个人不当言行与我司无关。
来源：中联重科公众号 据网上流传的现场视频显示，一辆摩托车正在车道上正常行驶，遭遇一辆黑色汽车连续变道，导致两车差点相撞，摩托车被迫停止行驶。
摩托车司机停车后问，“引导线你怎么开的？”一身穿 中联重科工装的男子 下车后称，“你管得着吗”？摩托车司机表示“你 ( 差点 ) 撞到我了”，该男子叫嚣道，“我撞你，你活该”“弄死你”。摩托车司机随后说“不好意思”，该男子继续怒喊“给我滚远点！”
网络视频截图 中联重科 今日股价未受到上述事件的影响。截至7月17日上午收盘， 中联重科(000157.SZ) 上涨0.27%报7.42元，市值为612亿元。昨日下午收盘，该股股价为7.40元/股，涨幅为0.27%。
官网资料显示，中联重科创立于1992年，主要从事工程机械、矿山机械、农业机械等高新技术装备的研发制造，主导产品涵盖15大类别、75个产品系列、745个型谱，是业内首家A+H股上市公司，注册资本86.78亿元，总资产1287亿元。现有29个国内工业园区，10个海外研发制造基地。
年报显示， 中联重科去年实现营业总收入454.78 亿元，同比减少3.39%；净利润35.2亿元，同比增长0.41%。
今年以来， 中联重科 业绩有所回升。财报显示，第一季度该公司实现营业收入121.17亿元，同比增长2.92%；归属于上市公司股东的净利润14.1亿元，同比增长53.98%。

author: Spencer Neale
title: Bannon to Jail for Contempt of Congress
text:
Bannon to Jail for Contempt of Congress
Steve Bannon is headed to jail.
The man partially responsible for engineering Donald Trump’s stunning 2016 victory will
report to prison on July 1 after a federal judge ordered he serve a four-month sentence for contempt of Congress.
“There’s not a prison or jail built that will ever shut me up. All victory to MAGA, we’re going to win this,”
remarked Bannon moments after the order came down outside a federal courthouse on Thursday.
U.S. District Judge Carl Nichols, a Trump appointee, revoked Bannon’s bail and approved the sentence after a federal appeals court last month rejected Bannon’s attempt to overturn his conviction for defying a subpoena from the January 6th Committee.
Bannon was convicted of two misdemeanor counts of contempt of Congress in 2022 after he refused to cooperate with the Democratic-led House of Representatives committee. Bannon now joins another top Trump ally, Peter Navarro, in prison. Navarro is similarly serving a four-month sentence.
The Committee had hoped to question Bannon about public comments he made about the 2020 election indicating he was involved in attempts to overturn it. Bannon and Navarro are credited with the “Green Bay Sweep” strategy whereby members of Congress would object to the certification of electoral votes.
Subscribe Today
Get daily emails in your inbox
The “Sweep” never materialized and Joe Biden was sworn in as president.
Bannon’s attorneys argued that the aptly nicknamed “Honey Badger” should remain a free man as the case works its way through an appeal process, but Nichols dismissed their arguments.
With his prison term to last until November, Bannon will now be sidelined during the most contentious part of the 2024 election season.

title: Your kitchen best friends are the 'drivers' of your increased household budget - The Economic Times
text: In recent times, the kitchen staples of tomatoes and onions have emerged as major culprits behind the rising food inflation in India, the Economic Survey showed Friday.While food inflation has been a global concern, India’s food inflation rate has remained steadfast for months now and a thorn on RBI's Monetary Policy. India’s retail inflation surged to a 14-month high of 6.2% in October, with food inflation reaching a 15-month high of 10.9%. However, December saw some respite from high prices as food inflation eased to 8.39 per cent in December from 9.04 per cent in November. Moreover, tomato prices were up 24 per cent at Rs 47 per kg in December, as per a CRISIL report. However, the new year might have brought some relief to India's households as common vegetables and staples such as tomato, potato, onion, rice and pulse have fallen by up to 40% in the first fortnight of 2025 sequentially.But is this relief here to stay?As per the survey, with the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI) indicating that vegetables and pulses are driving inflation, the factors fueling these price hikes have been identified as adverse weather and supply chain disruptions.Also Read: Economic Survey offers hope to 'aam aadmi' on inflation pains, subject to terms and conditionsOver the fiscal year 2025 (April-December), the combined weightage of vegetables and pulses in the Consumer Price Index (CPI) basket was a modest 8.42 per cent, yet their contribution to overall inflation reached a staggering 32.3 per cent, the report, prepared by the Chief Economic Advisor to the Finance Ministry, showed. The exclusion of these items from the inflation metrics reveals that the average food inflation rate dropped significantly to 4.3 per cent and headline inflation would be 3.2 per cent.The report further said that the root of these price surges can be traced back to supply chain disruptions powered by extreme weather events. The India Meteorological Department has reported a marked increase in extreme weather conditions—particularly heatwaves and unseasonal rainfall—over the past few years.Also Read: Economic Survey pitches for policy shift to cut cereal output, boost pulses, edible oils Such conditions have wreaked havoc on the production of vegetables leading to inflated prices at retail outlets.Why just tomatoes and onions?Tomatoes and onions, the quintessential ingredients in Indian kitchens, have seen their prices fluctuate dramatically due to uneven monsoon patterns and supply constraints.The Economic Survey said that these vegetables are particularly vulnerable to weather fluctuations; for instance, production of tomatoes, which has a short crop cycle and limited shelf life of 1-2 weeks, is concentrated in a few states. This concentration leaves the supply chain exposed to disruptions, leading to price spikes during lean production seasons.Similarly, onions, which are mainly harvested during the Rabi season, face inflationary pressures due to lower production levels in recent years. The average shelf life of fresh onions, lasting about 2-3 months under ideal storage conditions, means that any shortfall in production can significantly impact prices in subsequent months.However, production woes are not the sole contributor to the increased burden on the 'aam aadmis'' pockets, as per the survey. Analysis of production and consumption trends over the past three years, as per the report, reveals that domestic household consumption of both tomatoes and onions falls short of production levels. According to Horticultural Statistics at Glance 2021, approximately 15 per cent of the production is allocated for bulk consumption in hotels and events like marriages. Even when considering this as an addition to household consumption, production levels still exceed domestic consumption. Therefore, it turns out that price pressures are not fundamentally due to a shortfall in production but to post-harvest losses, seasonal production, and regional dispersion in production. Also, onion exports averaged more than 6 per cent of domestic production during FY20 to FY24, said the survey report. Moreover, India's reliance on domestic production for these staples limits its ability to import during times of demand-supply imbalances, the survey highlighted. With India and China accounting for nearly half of the global onion production, potential imports from other countries are limited, as the next eight major producers contribute only around 18 per cent of global output. Also, the highly perishable nature of tomatoes restricts import options from neighbouring countries, which are not significant producers of tomatoes. Consequently, India faces challenges in importing these essential commodities, the report read.

title: No interest in playing for Pakistan, says Shoaib Malik
text:
KARACHI - Veteran all-rounder Shoaib Malik on Thursday shared that he has lost interest in playing international cricket for Pakistan again.
Malik, who is already retired from two formats, during an interview with a local sports outlet, hinted that his days in international cricket are over.“No, I am happy and satisfied after playing for so many years. I have no interest in playing for Pakistan again,” Malik stated.“I have already announced retirement from two formats. I have been playing league cricket, and enjoying my time, wherever I get an opportunity to play, I try to avail it.”
Upon being asked about his retirement from T20 international cricket, the former captain stated that he would hang his boots from all forms of cricket altogether.“I have no interest but as I said in my previous interviews I will announce my retirement from all forms of cricket once and for all,” he said.
He also suggested that Pakistan’s white-ball captain, Babar Azam, should step down from captaincy and focus solely on his batting. Shoaib Malik believes that the star batter can perform better without the burden of captaincy on his shoulders.
“As for his captaincy, my firm stance is that he [Babar Azam] should play only as a player. That’s my opinion. When he plays as a player, he can do wonders for the team. He should stay away from leadership,” he added.
Shoaib Malik has represented Pakistan in 35 Tests, 287 ODIs and 124 T20Is since making his international debut back in 1999. He has scored over 11000 runs across three formats and has taken a total of 218 wickets.In league cricket, he is the second-highest run-scorer with 13360 runs, only behind West Indies legend Chris Gayle, who scored 14562 runs.

author: Ethan Stark-Miller
title: ‘Free to Pee’: Council members, advocates push bills to open up more public restrooms for New Yorkers | amNewYork
text:
The City Council is not holding it in and wants to ensure that New Yorkers do not have to, either.
Council members and advocates with the “Free to Pee” coalition rallied outside City Hall on Thursday to support two bills that aim to address the longstanding shortage of public restrooms throughout the five boroughs ahead of a public hearing on the legislation.
One bill seeks to expand the number of public lavatories in the Big Apple by requiring the city to make 45 bathrooms in some of its municipal buildings accessible to the public during business hours. The other would mandate that the city develop a long-term planning process for building one public bathroom for every 2,000 city residents by 2035.
City Council Member Sandy Nurse (D-Brooklyn), the prime sponsor of the bathroom planning bill, said the legislation is desperately needed because there is currently only one public restroom for about every 7,500 New Yorkers and only two in the entire city that are open 24 hours a day, seven days a week. She added that New Yorkers should not have to buy something from a private business just to use their bathroom or risk paying a ticket for relieving themselves in public.
“In a city of millions and millions of people who have a variety of different needs, it makes being in public space, being in public life, very difficult for many people,” Nurse said during the rally. “It shouldn’t matter if you have $5 on you to buy a coffee. It shouldn’t matter that you might not present yourself in a way to a private business that allows them to allow you to use the bathroom. You should be able to access, in public, when you are out and about, a public toilet.”
A public restroom in Union Square. Photo by Dean Moses With fewer public toilets available, more New Yorkers who just can’t wait any longer are breaking the law to find relief.
Nurse noted that the NYPD issued 9,904 criminal and civil summonses for public urination over the last fiscal year — a dramatic 46% increase from the year prior.
“We cannot be criminalizing people for a human function that every single person has,” Nurse said.
The lack of public restrooms disproportionately impacts vulnerable New Yorkers like homeless people and those with disabilities, the pols and advocates said.
Manhattan Borough President Mark Levine, who has been outspoken on the city’s lack of bathroom access, called the legislation to make restrooms in city buildings open to the public a “quick win that we can score.”
“We have a great bill now that would just open up public bathrooms that we’ve already built in public buildings, that are in use today but are not designated as open to the public and very few people know they exist,” Levine said.
The council’s push for the two bills comes a couple of weeks after it released a report finding that two-thirds of the 102 public restrooms they surveyed either had unsanitary conditions or were locked during operating hours.
It also comes on top of other efforts to boost the number of public restrooms accross the city. Those include a council bill that would require the city to finish building 151 new public bathrooms that it pledged to build in 2022 and a plan from Mayor Eric Adams to build 46 new public lavatories and renovate another 36.

title: Beloit to give street honorary rename in recognition of VetsRoll
text: Beloit to give street honorary rename in recognition of VetsRoll The City of Beloit will also host a ceremonial unveiling event on April 7 at 1 p.m. at the Harry Moore Pavilion in Riverside Park MADISON, Wis. (WMTV) - The City of Beloit is recognizing veterans, Rosie-the-Riveters and volunteers with an honorary street renaming. The honorary name “VetsRoll Drive” was approved by the Beloit City Council on March 4. Riverside Drive from White Avenue to Henry Avenue will soon feature signage to commemorate the name. VetsRoll, Inc is an organization that transports veterans to Washington, D.C. with a caravan of wheelchair lift-equipped charter coaches with volunteer assistants, media, support vehicles, police and motorcycle escorts. The City of Beloit will also host a ceremonial unveiling event on April 7 at 1 p.m. at the Harry Moore Pavilion in Riverside Park, 1160 S. Riverside Drive. In case of bad weather, the event will be held in the Rotary River Center building in Riverside Park, according to the City of Beloit. author: Abdul Latheef Naha
title: Nadwi likely to be stripped of Suprabhatam chief editor’s post - The Hindu
text:
The crisis in the Samastha Kerala Jamiyyathul Ulama, the largest body of Islamic clerics in the State, has worsened with senior Mushawara member Bahauddeen Muhammed Nadwi openly challenging the Samastha leadership for its pro-CPI(M) stance.
For Mr. Nadwi, like many other leaders of the Samastha, the scholars’ body should toe the line of the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML), a policy that the Samastha did for long.
Mr. Nadwi, who boycotted the Gulf edition launch of the Samastha mouthpiece Suprabhatam in Dubai on May 18 on the ground that the newspaper has had a major shift in its policy, appears to be a voice of the IUML in the Samastha.
Although Mr. Nadwi is the chief editor of the Suprabhatam , his role and influence in the shaping of the newspaper’s policies are insignificant. According to sources in the Samastha, he is likely to be removed from the chief editor’s post soon.
The Samastha leadership is waiting for Mr. Nadwi ‘s explanation to a memo that was served on him on Wednesday following some critical remarks that he made against the leadership headed by president Syed Jifri Muthukoya Thangal.
According to Samastha insiders, the leadership that follows the orthodox Islamic religious line abhors Mr. Nadwi and the policies of Darul Huda Islamic University, Chemmad, of which he is the Vice-Chancellor.
They consider Mr. Nadwi toeing the same line of Abdul Hakeem Faizy Adrisseri, who was expelled by the Samastha last year for the liberal policies that he adopted at the 80-odd institutions under the Coordination of Islamic Colleges (CIC) that he headed.
“There’s not much difference between Mr. Nadwi and Mr. Faizy. They are two sides of the same coin. They cannot think of a Samastha without the IUML,” said a hardliner demanding not to reveal his identity.
Both Mr. Faizy and Mr. Nadwi have been maintaining a pro-IUML stand and holding the IUML president in higher regard than the Samastha president.

title: EE.UU. permite a Kiev atacar la provincia rusa de Kursk con armas estadounidenses - RT
text:
EE.UU. permite a Kiev atacar la provincia rusa de Kursk con armas estadounidenses Publicado: 22 ago 2024 21:41 GMT El jefe del Pentágono se propone discutir con el ministro de Defensa ucraniano, en los próximos días, los planes de Kiev respecto a Kursk.
Maquinaria bélica de las FF.AA. de Ucrania destruida en la provincia rusa de Kursk. Ministerio de Defensa de Rusia / Sputnik Washington autorizó al régimen de Kiev a "contraatacar" contra Rusia con armamento estadounidense durante su incursión en la provincia rusa de Kursk, declaró la subsecretaria de prensa del Departamento de Defensa de EE.UU., Sabrina Singh.
"Nuestra política permite a Ucrania llevar a cabo contraataques para defenderse de los ataques rusos procedentes de esa región fronteriza, y eso incluye a Kursk y [la región ucraniana] Sumy. Así, pues, [los ucranianos] se están defendiendo de los ataques rusos dentro de esa región", dijo Singh en una rueda de prensa celebrada este jueves.
Borrell cree que atacar la profundidad de Rusia con armas occidentales avanzará la paz Al responder a una pregunta sobre lo que Kiev pretende conseguir en Kursk, Singh se refirió a las recientes declaraciones del líder del régimen ucraniano, Vladímir Zelenski, según las cuales uno de los objetivos principales es la creación de una zona de amortiguamiento.
Al mismo tiempo, la funcionaria precisó que el Pentágono todavía "tiene algunas preguntas más al respecto", como, por ejemplo, si los ucranianos tienen la intención de "mantener el control" sobre la provincia rusa, ya que "si van a crear una zona de amortiguamiento, eso implica la creación de múltiples líneas defensivas". "No tengo todas esas respuestas ahora mismo, pero es algo que el secretario [de Defensa de EE.UU., Lloyd Austin] va a discutir con el ministro [de Defensa ucraniano Rustem] Umérov de nuevo en los próximos días", afirmó.

author: Sylvie Duchesne
title: La première neige de l'année est tombée sur le Mont Aigoual - France Bleu
text: La première neige de l'année est tombée sur le Mont Aigoual La première neige de l'année 2024 est tombée sur le Mont Aigoual ! Un petit centimètre qui permet de blanchir le paysage et redonne le sourire aux responsables de la station Alti Aigoual. Pour ce premier jour de l'année 2024, la neige a fait son apparition au sommet du Mont Aigoual (Gard). "Ca fait plaisir parce que c'est tout blanc, mais ce n'est qu'un petit centimètre confie Denis Boissière, co-propriétaire et porte-parole de la station Alti Aigoual. On n'a jamais été aussi prêt. Toutes les équipes ont travaillé tout l'automne, maintenant, on attend la neige réellement avec impatience. On a du froid qui est annoncé aux alentours des 6/7 janvier, On est prêt à produire un peu de neige artificielle. On l'a réglé à -2,5°" Des balades avec un musher et des chiens de traineau Malgré ce très faible enneigement, plusieurs activités sont proposées pendant ces vacances scolaires. On peut notamment s'offrir une balade avec des chiens de traîneau. "C'est en kart, ça se fait en famille, le musher est très sympa. Ca permet de découvrir les paysages de l'Aigoual**."** On peut également allier course à pied et tir à la carabine laser, comme dans un biathlon. "S'il fait bon, ça se fait dehors, sinon, ça se fait à la cafétéria qui est ouverte." Denis Boissière reste persuadé que ce sont ces activités de plein air qui permettront à la station de survivre. Son rêve : construire un Bike Parc. "Ca permettrait, avec les remontées mécaniques de monter avec son VTT en haut de l'Aigoual et de redescendre via des sentiers qu'on aurait créés avec des petits modules en bois, ce qui serait très ludique. Ca a vraiment sa place à l'Aigoual car on a les compétences pour faire quelque chose d'intéressant. Même si ça ne sera pas aussi bien que dans les Alpes, ce n'est pas pour cela qu'on ne peut pas le faire." Clin d'œil au Parc national des Cévennes qui pour l'instant refuse cette construction. "Si les députés et les sénateurs gardois, les élus locaux, les associations, les socio-professionnels du massif, les associations de sport se mettent ensemble, le Parc n'aura pas d'autre choix que de changer d'avis." Ma France : quelle école pour demain ?
